simple.heading: Article 01
simple.text: All people are born free and equal.

simple.heading: Article 02
simple.text: Everyone is entitled to all the rights and freedoms in the Declaration of Human Rights.

simple.heading: Article 03
simple.text: Everyone has the right to a free and safe life.

simple.heading: Article 04
simple.text: No one should be enslaved; slavery should be prohibited.

simple.heading: Article 05
simple.text: No one should be subjected to torture.

simple.heading: Article 06
simple.text: Everyone has the right to be recognized as a person before the law.

simple.heading: Article 07
simple.text: Everyone is equal before the law and are entitled to equal protection.

simple.heading: Article 08
simple.text: Everyone has the right to compensation for acts violating their fundamental human rights.

simple.heading: Article 09
simple.text: No one should be arbitrarily arrested, detained, or exiled.

simple.heading: Article 10
simple.text: Everyone is entitled a fair and public hearing by an independent and impartial tribunal.

simple.heading: Article 11
simple.text: Everyone is innocent until proven guilty.

simple.heading: Article 12
simple.text: Everyone is entitled to their privacy.

simple.heading: Article 13
simple.text: Everyone has the right to freedom of residence and movement.

simple.heading: Article 14
simple.text: Everyone is entitled to seek and enjoy asylum from persecution.

simple.heading: Article 15
simple.text: Everyone has the right to a nationality.

simple.heading: Article 16
simple.text: Everyone has the right to marriage if both parties are fully consenting; they shall be protected by society and the State.

simple.heading: Article 17
simple.text: Everyone has the right to own property.

simple.heading: Article 18
simple.text: Everyone has the right to the freedom of thought, conscience, and religion.

simple.heading: Article 19
simple.text: Everyone has the right to freedom of opinion and expression.

simple.heading: Article 20
simple.text: Everyone has the right to peaceful assembly

simple.heading: Article 21
simple.text: Everyone has the right to participate in government equally.

simple.heading: Article 22
simple.text: Everyone has a right to social security.

simple.heading: Article 23
simple.text: Everyone has the right to work in just conditions; with equal pay for equal work; and the right to form and join trade unions.

simple.heading: Article 24
simple.text: Everyone has the right to rest and leisure.

simple.heading: Article 25
simple.text: Everyone has the right to a standard of living adequate for health and well-being.

simple.heading: Article 26
simple.text: Everyone has a right to education.

simple.heading: Article 27
simple.text: Everyone has the right to participate in the cultural life of the community.

simple.heading: Article 28
simple.text: Everyone is entitled to the freedoms within this Declaration.

simple.heading: Article 29
simple.text: The only limits to rights and freedoms are subject to laws that respect the rights and freedoms declared in this document.

simple.heading: Article 30
simple.text: Nothing in this Declaration should be aimed at the destruction of any of the rights or freedoms.

full.heading: Article 01
full.text: All human beings are born free and equal in dignity and rights. They are endowed with reason and conscience and should act towards one another in a spirit of brotherhood.

full.heading: Article 02
full.text: Everyone is entitled to all the rights and freedoms set forth in this Declaration, without distinction of any kind, such as race, colour, sex, language, religion, political or other opinion, national or social origin, property, birth or other status. Furthermore, no distinction shall be made on the basis of the political, jurisdictional or international status of the country or territory to which a person belongs, whether it be independent, trust, non-self-governing or under any other limitation of sovereignty.

full.heading: Article 03
full.text: Everyone has the right to life, liberty and security of person.

full.heading: Article 04
full.text: No one shall be held in slavery or servitude; slavery and the slave trade shall be prohibited in all their forms.

full.heading: Article 05
full.text: No one shall be subjected to torture or to cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment.

full.heading: Article 06
full.text: Everyone has the right to recognition everywhere as a person before the law.

full.heading: Article 07
full.text: All are equal before the law and are entitled without any discrimination to equal protection of the law. All are entitled to equal protection against any discrimination in violation of this Declaration and against any incitement to such discrimination.

full.heading: Article 08
full.text: Everyone has the right to an effective remedy by the competent national tribunals for acts violating the fundamental rights granted him by the constitution or by law.

full.heading: Article 09
full.text: No one shall be subjected to arbitrary arrest, detention or exile.

full.heading: Article 10
full.text: Everyone is entitled in full equality to a fair and public hearing by an independent and impartial tribunal, in the determination of his rights and obligations and of any criminal charge against him.

full.heading: Article 11
full.text: (1) Everyone charged with a penal offence has the right to be presumed innocent until proved guilty according to law in a public trial at which he has had all the guarantees necessary for his defence.</br>(2) No one shall be held guilty of any penal offence on account of any act or omission which did not constitute a penal offence, under national or international law, at the time when it was committed. Nor shall a heavier penalty be imposed than the one that was applicable at the time the penal offence was committed.

full.heading: Article 12
full.text: No one shall be subjected to arbitrary interference with his privacy, family, home or correspondence, nor to attacks upon his honour and reputation. Everyone has the right to the protection of the law against such interference or attacks.

full.heading: Article 13
full.text: (1) Everyone has the right to freedom of movement and residence within the borders of each state.</br>(2) Everyone has the right to leave any country, including his own, and to return to his country.

full.heading: Article 14
full.text: (1) Everyone has the right to seek and to enjoy in other countries asylum from persecution.</br>(2) This right may not be invoked in the case of prosecutions genuinely arising from non-political crimes or from acts contrary to the purposes and principles of the United Nations.

full.heading: Article 15
full.text: (1) Everyone has the right to a nationality.</br>(2) No one shall be arbitrarily deprived of his nationality nor denied the right to change his nationality.

full.heading: Article 16
full.text: (1) Men and women of full age, without any limitation due to race, nationality or religion, have the right to marry and to found a family. They are entitled to equal rights as to marriage, during marriage and at its dissolution.</br>(2) Marriage shall be entered into only with the free and full consent of the intending spouses.</br>(3) The family is the natural and fundamental group unit of society and is entitled to protection by society and the State.

full.heading: Article 17
full.text: (1) Everyone has the right to own property alone as well as in association with others.</br>(2) No one shall be arbitrarily deprived of his property.

full.heading: Article 18
full.text: Everyone has the right to freedom of thought, conscience and religion; this right includes freedom to change his religion or belief, and freedom, either alone or in community with others and in public or private, to manifest his religion or belief in teaching, practice, worship and observance.

full.heading: Article 19
full.text: Everyone has the right to freedom of opinion and expression; this right includes freedom to hold opinions without interference and to seek, receive and impart information and ideas through any media and regardless of frontiers.

full.heading: Article 20
full.text: (1) Everyone has the right to freedom of peaceful assembly and association.</br>(2) No one may be compelled to belong to an association.

full.heading: Article 21
full.text: (1) Everyone has the right to take part in the government of his country, directly or through freely chosen representatives</br>(2) Everyone has the right of equal access to public service in his country.</br>(3) The will of the people shall be the basis of the authority of government; this will shall be expressed in periodic and genuine elections which shall be by universal and equal suffrage and shall be held by secret vote or by equivalent free voting procedures.

full.heading: Article 22
full.text: Everyone, as a member of society, has the right to social security and is entitled to realization, through national effort and international co-operation and in accordance with the organization and resources of each State, of the economic, social and cultural rights indispensable for his dignity and the free development of his personality

full.heading: Article 23
full.text:
(1) Everyone has the right to work, to free choice of employment, to just and favourable conditions of work and to protection against unemployment.
    (2) Everyone, without any discrimination, has the right to equal pay for equal work.</br>(3) Everyone who works has the right to just and favourable remuneration ensuring for himself and his family an existence worthy of human dignity, and supplemented, if necessary, by other means of social protection.</br>(4) Everyone has the right to form and to join trade unions for the protection of his interests.
